case_data.name: Miller v. Amusement Enterprises
case_data.summary: [This summary is temporary while we research the case.] This is a lawsuit in which an African-American mother sued the owners of an amusement park, seeking to enjoin them from denying her children and other African-Americans access to the park. The case was filed in 1965, in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Louisiana.
